blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: As for what Phil is doing wrong, I think it is not evolving. Some youtubers like Shane and Pewdiepie have evolved and become...
question: As for what Phil is doing wrong, I think it is not evolving. Some youtubers like Shane and Pewdiepie have evolved and become relevant again. It comes down to whether or not phil wants to do that or if he is happy just sitting back and doing what he wants even if he is going to decline in popularity and earn less. I think it’s pretty clear he isn’t interested in or maybe isn’t capable of redefining himself. I think Dans more of a wildcard who has more potential IF he wanted to put in the effort
answer: Maybe you do have a point there. I can’t speak on Felix really, because I don’t fuck with that guy, but I’ve watched Shane for a very long time and watched him bounce back time and time again. He seems to know how to play YouTube like a fiddle, keeping up with trends and doing exactly what current YouTube viewers want to see and throwing his entire being into it. Whereas someone like Phil, doesn’t seem interested in playing YouTube’s game. I think YouTube, for Phil, has always been a hobby first and a job second. So he’s just making what he wants to make and if that happens to match up with what people want to watch, then great. If not, oh well. And we’re in a cycle right now where the videos Phil makes aren’t the videos people go looking for. If trends change and Phil-style videos come back into fashion, maybe he’ll get another surge of popularity.

reblog.comment: Maybe you do have a point there. I can’t speak on Felix really, because I don’t fuck with that guy, but I’ve watched Shane for a very long time and watched him bounce back time and time again. He seems to know how to play YouTube like a fiddle, keeping up with trends and doing exactly what current YouTube viewers want to see and throwing his entire being into it. Whereas someone like Phil, doesn’t seem interested in playing YouTube’s game. I think YouTube, for Phil, has always been a hobby first and a job second. So he’s just making what he wants to make and if that happens to match up with what people want to watch, then great. If not, oh well. And we’re in a cycle right now where the videos Phil makes aren’t the videos people go looking for. If trends change and Phil-style videos come back into fashion, maybe he’ll get another surge of popularity.

trail.content_raw: Maybe you do have a point there. I can’t speak on Felix really, because I don’t fuck with that guy, but I’ve watched Shane for a very long time and watched him bounce back time and time again. He seems to know how to play YouTube like a fiddle, keeping up with trends and doing exactly what current YouTube viewers want to see and throwing his entire being into it. Whereas someone like Phil, doesn’t seem interested in playing YouTube’s game. I think YouTube, for Phil, has always been a hobby first and a job second. So he’s just making what he wants to make and if that happens to match up with what people want to watch, then great. If not, oh well. And we’re in a cycle right now where the videos Phil makes aren’t the videos people go looking for. If trends change and Phil-style videos come back into fashion, maybe he’ll get another surge of popularity.
trail.content: Maybe you do have a point there. I can’t speak on Felix really, because I don’t fuck with that guy, but I’ve watched Shane for a very long time and watched him bounce back time and time again. He seems to know how to play YouTube like a fiddle, keeping up with trends and doing exactly what current YouTube viewers want to see and throwing his entire being into it. Whereas someone like Phil, doesn’t seem interested in playing YouTube’s game. I think YouTube, for Phil, has always been a hobby first and a job second. So he’s just making what he wants to make and if that happens to match up with what people want to watch, then great. If not, oh well. And we’re in a cycle right now where the videos Phil makes aren’t the videos people go looking for. If trends change and Phil-style videos come back into fashion, maybe he’ll get another surge of popularity.

blog.name: phanfeed-ao3
blog.title: Phanfiction!
blog.description:
!!! READ THE FAQ BEFORE SENDING ME AN ASK !!!

Mobile Links

This blog is autoposts anything that gets put in the Dan Howell/Phil Lester tag on Archive of Our Own (AO3).

Sometimes the applet on IFTT I use straight up breaks. I don't recommend turning on notifications for this blog. Links don't work on mobile.

Admin: Ozzy (foolishdeadbeat)

title: let me show you
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2NvoJuF

by delightedpml

dan was born a colour bandit, emotionless and one of the most destructive creatures in the universes. he doesn’t mind his evil and repetitive life, but once tragedy strikes, dan finds himself loathing the monster he was born to be.

phil was born colourful, full of emotion just like every other human. he tries to be just how he’s wanted to be, but each day the task grows harder and harder, and phil finds himself wearing a mask of happiness wherever he goes.

when dan is forced to return to his home planet, he’s lost all hope. when phil arrives at his favorite cliff side, he has as well. when the two meet, both of their world’s rapidly change…but is it for the better or worse?

~a story about finding your true colors~

Words: 1326, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Phandom/The Fantastic Foursome (YouTube RPF)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M, M/M

  • Relationships: Dan Howell/Phil Lester

blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: Interesting how you think Phil's videos have been improving for the past several months (and I kinda agree with that), but he's...
question: Interesting how you think Phil's videos have been improving for the past several months (and I kinda agree with that), but he's been losing more subs than ever at the same time, each time he uploads and even if he doesn't. Do you think he's actually doing something really wrong now? I think people will keep unsubbing regardless of what he does, it could be a Tyler Oakley/Alfie Deyes situation, I would never group Phil with those people and their content but maybe to others he's the same as them
answer: Phil is past his YouTube prime, plain and simple. Most creators have a shelf life, and Phil has gone past his sell-by date. Not that it’s a bad thing, and I’m not trying to bash Phil or anything, but that’s how YouTube works. You’re not famous, then you are famous, then you’re not again. Usually all within the span of a few years. So I don’t think Phil is doing anything wrong, I think he’s just in that phase of his youtuber-metamorphosis where people are moving on. Like I said in the last ask, Phil’s videos aren’t creative or original anymore. When I say they’ve been improving, maybe I mean that Phil himself seems more genuine and happy with what he’s doing, even if what he’s doing is nothing special. He’s pumping out a video a week lately, which has been pretty much unheard of up until now. So I think he’s just reached a point where he’s done worrying, and he’s doing whatever he wants and he’s enjoying himself.

trail.content_raw: Phil is past his YouTube prime, plain and simple. Most creators have a shelf life, and Phil has gone past his sell-by date. Not that it’s a bad thing, and I’m not trying to bash Phil or anything, but that’s how YouTube works. You’re not famous, then you are famous, then you’re not again. blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: yes to the last anon who unsubscribed from Phil. I’ve never seen anyone say it but yes I unsubscribed too bc I just don’t find...
question: yes to the last anon who unsubscribed from Phil. I’ve never seen anyone say it but yes I unsubscribed too bc I just don’t find his recent videos meh. I get so confused when I see people talking about him being in a creative renaissance. Fiverr??? Message to his younger self?? Those trends have been around on youtube for years now and have been done better. I don’t get it. I miss creative Phil.
answer: I will agree that there’s nothing creative about Phil’s videos anymore. His videos are all very easy to make and there’s nothing really original or groundbreaking about them.

reblog.comment: I will agree that there’s nothing creative about Phil’s videos anymore. His videos are all very easy to make and there’s nothing really original or groundbreaking about them.

trail.content_raw: I will agree that there’s nothing creative about Phil’s videos anymore. His videos are all very easy to make and there’s nothing really original or groundbreaking about them.
trail.content: I will agree that there’s nothing creative about Phil’s videos anymore. His videos are all very easy to make and there’s nothing really original or groundbreaking about them.

blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: i find the differences between the lesters and the howells in terms of how public they are and the separate fan cultures dan and...
question: i find the differences between the lesters and the howells in terms of how public they are and the separate fan cultures dan and phil have constructed around their specific family. why do people feel more comfortable interacting with phil's family? they've always casually existed in his public sphere. dan's family, on the other hand, has always been a taboo subject (and rightfully so, they have a right to privacy), which is why ppl are chill w martyn but unsure how to approach adrian.
answer: I agree that people are much more hesitant to talk about Dan’s family openly and fan over them the way they do Phil’s family because Phil’s family is more public and I think it’s good that there is an attempt to respect Dan’s family, who are younger and out there still living their lives with jobs and school and stuff, in that way. However, when people do talk about Dan’s family, I have often seen them do it in a negative way and I do think that’s worse in a lot of ways because then you don’t have the opportunity for people to strike down the things they are saying in the way you would see if someone was saying negative things more publicly. I’m hesitant to even go into some of the things I’ve heard people say over the years because I don’t want to contribute to putting that crap on the internet any more than it already is, but to just focus on Adrian, I think people are afraid of how to approach the topic of him with Dan, but I don’t see the caution when it comes with how they talk about or interact with Adrian himself. I have seen many examples over the past couple of months where people would say negative things about Adrian, but then also express fear over themselves or anyone in the phandom talking about him out loud and it’s not hard to gather that it’s because they are afraid of Dan being upset with the phandom for treating his family poorly, not because they have respect for them. I personally think the problem is that because Dan’s family has been more private, the phandom has made up roles for them using dramatic headcannon in this narrative that it collectively created and want Dan and Phil’s lives to follow and therefore would rather them remain hidden and silent in order to avoid the cognitive dissonance caused by the reality of who they are and their relationships with Dan interfering with the fantasy. The more they do exist publicly and cause these issues, like Adrian is doing now, the less the phandom likes it and we are left with the underlying anger. That’s my opinion.

blog.name: howell-lesters
blog.description: queer people exist, choosing not to accept them is not an option

body: @danielhowell is that you?

reblog.comment: @danielhowell is that you?

trail.content_raw: @danielhowell is that you?

blog.name: phanfictioncatalogue
blog.title: phanfiction catalogue
blog.description:
mobile users, click here!

please refer to our FAQ first.

Our goal is to create an alphabetized library of every phanfiction in the phandom. Besides that, we compile masterlists of different genres that are scheduled for posting every few days, and help find fics that have been mislocated.

title: Illnesses Masterlist
body:
A Night Of Normalcy - phandabbydosey

Summary: Dan just wished he could be normal again and is left heartbroken after his illness forces him to miss his school prom. Hating seeing his boyfriend so down, Phil finds a way to give him the perfect night he deserves.

An Odyssey (ao3) - The UKAmazingDan

Summary: Dan got the part he wanted in the play. Too bad his appendix decided to act up.

Endless - thecrappyauthor

Summary: Dan is juggling depression, anxiety, eating problems, and abuse. His world is a never ending gray cloud. At least it is until he meets Phil, a popular handsome boy who for some reason will not give up on getting to know Dan.

Flares (ao3) - huphilpuffs

Summary: Dan’s body has been broken for as long as he can remember, and he’s long since learned to deal with it. Sort of. But when his symptoms force him to leave uni and move into a new flat with a stranger named Phil, he finds that ignoring the pain isn’t the way to make himself happy.

Forgetting The Sunshine (ao3) - obsessivechild

Summary: “It’s sweet of you to look after me but really, you can go home now.”

Phil just smiled as he plumped Dan’s pillow and said, “I live here, Dan.”

It started with just forgetting the oven was on or forgetting to change his trousers.

But how do you react when the love of your life doesn’t even remember you?

Get Well Soon - darling-phil

Summary: When Dan is diagnosed with pneumonia, Phil’s there to comfort him through the frustration of being ill.

How to Be Amazing (ao3) - phanburnhamizzard

Summary: Phil Lester is strong. He is amazing. But after months on tour battling car sickness, stage fright, and fatigue, it is all becoming too much. One night, in the middle of Interactive Introverts, Phil pushes himself to the brink.

I Hope You Understand - placingglaciers

Summary: In which Dan does something unexpected, but honorable, while reminiscing Phil’s struggle with cancer.

Landslide (ao3) - dannihowell (iguessicantry)

Summary: Phil hasn’t seen Dan in almost four years. Dan is a carrier and now has a 3 year old son. He also has very big a secret.

Lay My Weary Head Against Your Bones (Where All Our Troubles Will Be Dead And Gone) (ao3) - rainbowroshenpower

Summary: In which Dan and Phil are the closest of friends until Dan gets sick and his parents decide to send him away.

Like A Computer (ao3) - starboydjh

Summary: Dan’s brain is like a computer and needs to reboot itself sometimes. It just so happens that his brain needs to reboot when Dan’s home alone with Phil’s parents during their Christmas trip to the Lester home base.

Someday - philsdrill

Summary: “Everyone had a link with their soulmates, some could hear some of their partners thoughts, some had a tattoo that would appear with their partners name; for me, I knew when they got sick.” For a while Phil has thought that his soulmate might have an eating disorder and doesn’t expect to meet him in the restaurant where he works.

Stay Hydrated - philsdrill

Summary: At a YouTube convention, Dan gets up too fast in excitement to see his American friends. What seems to be a combination of dehydration and his orthostatic hypotension causes him to pass out.

Take Me By The Hand (ao3) - amczingphil

Summary: Dan suffers from a severe genetic disorder that has forced him to spend his entire life indoors, going outside is too dangerous for him as he has no immune system and catching any illness can result in his death.

He was as content as he could be given his situation, he would fill his time watching his neighbours and creating elaborate stories about their lives in his head, until Phil Lester moved in across the street.

Now Dan can’t stop thinking about the man with the plants and suddenly his ‘normal’ life isn’t as satisfying as it had once been.

Talking to the Moon - adorablehowell

Summary: Dan hides away from the melancholy in his life by sitting on the balcony with the stars as his only source of happiness, but he encounters a man named Phil who likes to sing songs on his own balcony, and Dan finds the stars are not his only friends out there.

The Hardest Part Of This (Is Leaving You) (ao3) - alivingflop

Summary: Dan Howell is dying. He has terminal cancer, and is living out his last few months in a hospice care facility. But, when he starts a relationship and falls in love with his hospice nurse, Phil, it becomes all too hard to say goodbye.

The Power of Friendship (ao3) - phanburnhamizzard

Summary: Something is not right with Dan. Years after tragically losing his best friend, Rick, Phil has finally let his guard down and found a new friend in Dan Howell. But, lately, Dan has seemed unwell. What is going on with Dan? And if the unthinkable were to happen, could Phil survive another tragic loss?

These Violent Delights Of Love (ao3) - euphoricxdystopia

Summary: Dan is hopelessly in love, Phil’s seemingly oblivious and they’re on a world tour just to make things more chaotic.

And yet, the Gods, or the Ruler of the Universe, or whoever the hell was in charge decided Dan needed to die in the end, too. Currently, leaning over the porcelain throne of shit and piss was the Gods’ human voodoo doll, throwing up the contents of his unfortunate Indian dinner – and significantly more alarming than that: black tulips. Fucking flowers. This wasn’t real life.

The Story Of A Little Boy And An Angel On Earth - crescendohowell

Summary: Once upon a time there was a little boy that wished he could grow wings. He wished that he would be able to fly and escape. Only he didn’t expect to find a best friend who was, in the little boy’s mind, an angel on earth.

trail.content:
A Night Of Normalcy - phandabbydosey

Summary: Dan just wished he could be normal again and is left heartbroken after his illness forces him to miss his school prom. Hating seeing his boyfriend so down, Phil finds a way to give him the perfect night he deserves.

An Odyssey (ao3) - The UKAmazingDan

Summary: Dan got the part he wanted in the play. Too bad his appendix decided to act up.

Endless - thecrappyauthor

Summary: Dan is juggling depression, anxiety, eating problems, and abuse. His world is a never ending gray cloud. At least it is until he meets Phil, a popular handsome boy who for some reason will not give up on getting to know Dan.

Flares (ao3) - huphilpuffs

Summary: Dan’s body has been broken for as long as he can remember, and he’s long since learned to deal with it. Sort of. But when his symptoms force him to leave uni and move into a new flat with a stranger named Phil, he finds that ignoring the pain isn’t the way to make himself happy.

Forgetting The Sunshine (ao3) - obsessivechild

Summary: “It’s sweet of you to look after me but really, you can go home now.”

Phil just smiled as he plumped Dan’s pillow and said, “I live here, Dan.”

It started with just forgetting the oven was on or forgetting to change his trousers.

But how do you react when the love of your life doesn’t even remember you?

Get Well Soon - darling-phil

Summary: When Dan is diagnosed with pneumonia, Phil’s there to comfort him through the frustration of being ill.

How to Be Amazing (ao3) - phanburnhamizzard

Summary: Phil Lester is strong. He is amazing. But after months on tour battling car sickness, stage fright, and fatigue, it is all becoming too much. One night, in the middle of Interactive Introverts, Phil pushes himself to the brink.

I Hope You Understand - placingglaciers

Summary: In which Dan does something unexpected, but honorable, while reminiscing Phil’s struggle with cancer.

Landslide (ao3) - dannihowell (iguessicantry)

Summary: Phil hasn’t seen Dan in almost four years. Dan is a carrier and now has a 3 year old son. He also has very big a secret.

Lay My Weary Head Against Your Bones (Where All Our Troubles Will Be Dead And Gone) (ao3) - rainbowroshenpower

Summary: In which Dan and Phil are the closest of friends until Dan gets sick and his parents decide to send him away.

Like A Computer (ao3) - starboydjh

Summary: Dan’s brain is like a computer and needs to reboot itself sometimes. It just so happens that his brain needs to reboot when Dan’s home alone with Phil’s parents during their Christmas trip to the Lester home base.

Someday - philsdrill

Summary: “Everyone had a link with their soulmates, some could hear some of their partners thoughts, some had a tattoo that would appear with their partners name; for me, I knew when they got sick.” For a while Phil has thought that his soulmate might have an eating disorder and doesn’t expect to meet him in the restaurant where he works.

Stay Hydrated - philsdrill

Summary: At a YouTube convention, Dan gets up too fast in excitement to see his American friends. What seems to be a combination of dehydration and his orthostatic hypotension causes him to pass out.

Take Me By The Hand (ao3) - amczingphil

Summary: Dan suffers from a severe genetic disorder that has forced him to spend his entire life indoors, going outside is too dangerous for him as he has no immune system and catching any illness can result in his death.

He was as content as he could be given his situation, he would fill his time watching his neighbours and creating elaborate stories about their lives in his head, until Phil Lester moved in across the street.

Now Dan can’t stop thinking about the man with the plants and suddenly his ‘normal’ life isn’t as satisfying as it had once been.

Talking to the Moon - adorablehowell

Summary: Dan hides away from the melancholy in his life by sitting on the balcony with the stars as his only source of happiness, but he encounters a man named Phil who likes to sing songs on his own balcony, and Dan finds the stars are not his only friends out there.

The Hardest Part Of This (Is Leaving You) (ao3) - alivingflop

Summary: Dan Howell is dying. He has terminal cancer, and is living out his last few months in a hospice care facility. But, when he starts a relationship and falls in love with his hospice nurse, Phil, it becomes all too hard to say goodbye.

The Power of Friendship (ao3) - phanburnhamizzard

Summary: Something is not right with Dan. Years after tragically losing his best friend, Rick, Phil has finally let his guard down and found a new friend in Dan Howell. But, lately, Dan has seemed unwell. What is going on with Dan? And if the unthinkable were to happen, could Phil survive another tragic loss?

These Violent Delights Of Love (ao3) - euphoricxdystopia

Summary: Dan is hopelessly in love, Phil’s seemingly oblivious and they’re on a world tour just to make things more chaotic.

And yet, the Gods, or the Ruler of the Universe, or whoever the hell was in charge decided Dan needed to die in the end, too. Currently, leaning over the porcelain throne of shit and piss was the Gods’ human voodoo doll, throwing up the contents of his unfortunate Indian dinner – and significantly more alarming than that: black tulips. Fucking flowers. This wasn’t real life.

The Story Of A Little Boy And An Angel On Earth - crescendohowell

Summary: Once upon a time there was a little boy that wished he could grow wings. He wished that he would be able to fly and escape. Only he didn’t expect to find a best friend who was, in the little boy’s mind, an angel on earth.
